greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write n = C(i,4)+C(j,3)+C(k,2)+C(l,1) with i>j>k>l>=0; let L[n] = [i,j,k,l]; sequence gives list of quadruples L[n], n >= 0.
comment: Each n >= 0 has a unique representation as n = C(i,4)+C(j,3)+C(k,2)+C(l.1) with i>j>k>l>=0. This is the combinatorial number system of degree t = 4, where we get [A194882, A194883, A194884, A127324]. For degree t = 3 see A194847.
reference: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming, vol. 4A, Combinatorial Algorithms, Section 7.2.1.3, Eq. (20), p. 360.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 04 2011
